course.subject: ECON
course.name: Macroeconomic Theory I
course.description: This course will concentrate on introducing the basics terms of macroeconomics, business cycle analysis, money and inflation, current accounts, and exchange rates. Exclusively for students of the BSc in Economics and Finance and Mathematics and Economics program.
course.exclusions: ECON 2123, ECON 3024, SOSC 102I, SOSC 1440

reviews.author: wen moon ser
reviews.comment_content:
** Syllabus Change After 2021 Fall **

Macroeconomics既第一個course。如果你同ECON3113一齊讀呢個course，你會發現呢個course相比下簡單好多。ECON3123係專俾ECOF同MAEC讀，但內容上同ECON2123其實差唔多，只係加加減減小修小補咁。最主要唔同既就係ISLM model係assume LM curve horizontal因為interest rate fully controlled by the Fed。同埋ASAD model用ISLMPC model取代咗，仲有無教open economy，但教咗financial crisis。如果有讀DSE Econ既話，midterm之前應該會有少少幫助，midterm之後就係全新既野。呢個course既數學難極有限，盡其量都係啲equations掉下位咁，但Prof. 有時會發神經，加一堆multivariable calculus去prove野。考試最難都係用first order condition姐，唔洗驚俾NDS屈機。

內容：
1. Introduction to macroeconomic variables (GDP，inflation果啲野，DSE程度)

2. Economy in the short run (講good markets同financial markets，再擺埋一齊搵equilibrium）
    2.1. Goods market: Keynesian Consumption Model
    2.2. Financial market and monetary policies
    2.3. IS-LM model
    2.4. Extended IS-LM model (real interest rate, risk premium)
    2.5. The 2008 Financial Crisis

------------------------midterm--------------------------

3. Economy in the medium run (開始複雜，加埋input market，所有野會擺埋一齊）
    3.1. Labour market
    3.2. Phillips Curve, Natural Rate of Unemployment
    3.3. IS-LM-PC model

4. Economic Growth (同前面啲野關係唔大，奇奇怪怪咁，要多啲數學，講long run點解會有growth，只有technology先trigger到long-term growth）
    4.1. Facts of Growth
    4.2. Saving, Capital Accumulation, Outputs
    4.3. Technological Progress and Growth
    4.4. Technological Progress, Wages and Unemployment

成個course設計上好似由一開始好多assumption再慢慢release啲assumption，例始由price level係fixed變唔fixed。但無好好咁交代清楚，令到成個course好亂好複雜，最後個long run簡直九唔搭八。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lu Yang 講書又無聊又難follow，佢成日會開excel玩數據，播下新聞，但其實啲新聞同數據真係唔知做緊咩，完全follow唔到。教書又照powerpoint讀，有時佢會寫啲mainpoint/教你畫graph 會手寫notes。但都係好混亂。上堂問問題十題有九題佢都答唔到，佢會話呢個唔係佢profession，但我反而覺得係無備課。佢唯一比較好既地方就係佢會帶你由0畫一次graph。佢啲英文以大陸prof.黎講都唔算差既。

TA 9成9係astor，最重要既係第一堂tutorial千祈唔好上千祈唔好上，佢係到同你撳啲有macro data既網，完全唔知做緊咩。Lu Yang話過上tutorial係要帶電腦要唔知做data定點，結果第一堂之後無掂過data，真係吹脹。之後嗰啲tutorial就係瘋狂間tutorial notes，無咩作為。但其實佢份notes同exercises都ok，唔想上可以搵人幫手拎notes/拎完就走。
reviews.comment_grading:
好靚grade。Prof. 第一堂就講到明會派A range派到最盡最盡，好似話會派30% A range。再加上佢midterm 同 assignment真係派分，大家坐底會有B，勤力多少少就有A range。佢midterm係超容易，但final就幾難下。homework就淨係揀幾條黎check，仲要100分開始倒扣，就算錯晒都應該有9X分。

Grading Policy:
Homework 10%
Midterm 35%
Final 55%

General Performance:
Midterm:
Mean: 76.32/100
Median: 76/100
Standard Deviation: 12.86

Final:
Mean: 64.49/100
Median: 65.5/100
Standard Deviation: 16.32

My Performance:
Homework: 100/100
Midterm: 99/100
Final: 79/100

Final Grade: A

Midterm係有溫書就一定識晒，final就唔知搞咩，2條long questons，一堆數同好難既graph drawing。但佢臨尾好似有一條出錯咗，所以所有人都有分定唔知點，總之就亂七八糟。另外astor 改exam都係亂改，有啲位條題目寫得唔好佢都唔會讓步，同一個錯可以唔同人扣唔同分。
reviews.comment_workload: 好輕workload，兩分assignment好簡單，十題左右，比心機做，兩三個鐘一定做完。midterm亦都唔多material要溫，所以呢個course chur就只chur在final period。

reviews.author: Rigbones
reviews.title: Byoungchan is great!
reviews.comment_content:
Content is somewhat similar to ECON 2123 but some parts are different.  The LM curve is assumed flat, also 2123 covers AS-AD model but 3123 covers the PC curve.

Microeconomics knowledge is not needed at all.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Byoungchan is a great professor.  He explains slowly and clearly so no one falls behind.  In class, he always asks "do you guys all understand", "any questions" etc which shows he cares about his teaching quality a lot.  Also, for most of the other courses I took this semester, towards November less than half of the students attended lectures, but Byoungchan's lectures had a consistently high participation rate.  Proof of good professor!

Another thing that's really great is his exam papers are designed so if you study hard, you are rewarded well.  Some professors like to design ridiculous exams just for the sake of getting a more distributed curve but he doesn't.
reviews.comment_grading:
Given that this course is only for ECOF and MAEC students, the mean is much higher than usual (I am actually a CS guy but I can still get in.  Interesting.).  Also the class size is very small (this sem around 3X), but the grading is still quite good.

Grades for reference:
Midterm  93/100, mean 91.53
Final       91/100, mean 80.32
Assignment full
Letter grade A+

Byoungchan will release all the previous exam papers on canvas, which is really nice.  Some short
questions in the actual exam will look similar, so try to complete all the past exams he uploads
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload
4 Assignments, not hard but need to do a little data handling so don't do it last minute
1 midterm
1 final

reviews.author: Kuhaku

reviews.author: citiben
reviews.title: Good grade course for ECOF and MAEC students
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to ECON2123, but more advanced.
Teaching Extended IS-LM model (replace nominal interest rate with real interest rate) and IS-LM-PC

Generally, the content is interesting and easy to follow (if you studied DSE Economics before).

While it don't required complex mathematics calculation, just simple linear algebra. The only difficult part is the derivation of PC from PS and WS relation. Therefore, you can take this course before you finished ECON2174.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Lee teach very well. He explains the content detailedly, the lecture is interesting and interactive. He is willing to answer the questions, after the lecture or in email. It helps me to clarify the concepts and have more in-depth knowledge in macroeconomics.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade course.

Problem set: 20%
Mid-term: 40%
Final exam: 40%

As long as you submit the problem sets on time, you would get the full marks (of course you answer should make sense to show your effort)

For the mid-term exam, it is easy and the mean is around 92%.
But for the final exam, it is much more difficult and the mean is 80%.

As the students taking this course are mainly ECOF and MAEC students. Therefore, this course is competitive. But if you above mean in both mid-term and final exam. You would get A range most probably.
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate workload.

There are four problems sets. As mentioned, the problem sets are not difficult and easy to get full marks. Thus, you don't need to worry too much about the assignment.

However, as the weighting for mid-term and final exam is the same. You should spend your time to study for the mid-term exam as well. Problem sets and tutorial questions could help you to review the concepts and have practices for the exams.

Also, the final exam is non-cumulative. But the concepts of IS-LM would apply in later chapters. It's essential to build a solid foundation in IS-LM before the mid-term.

reviews.author: Christina_1210
reviews.comment_content:
Relatively easy.
Can easily master the content through lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures notes are great!  There are many graphs to help you better understand the topic.
Speaking is also grate, you can easily understand the materials .
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm and final are both relatively easy. As long as you can fully understand the course materials, you can get a good mark. However, mean is really high and SD is really low.
That means , everyone gets a good grade but not everyone can get A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 4 assignments in total. Each assignment you can work with your friends or seek for TA's help.
Assignments are easy to complete, each with 5-6questions.

reviews.author: rind
reviews.title: Shouldn't this course be a 4-credit course?
reviews.comment_content:
First course to macroeconomics
Textbook: Blanchard Macroeconomics, 8th edition, Pearson (DO REMEMBER TO GET ONE)

Syllabus changed in this year, much more content is involved.
1. Introduction (ch1)
2. GDP, Unemployment and Inflation rate (ch2)
---short run---
3. Goods market (ch3)
4. Financial market (ch4)
5. IS-LM model: equilibrium of Goods and Financial Markets (ch5)
---medium run---
6. The Labor Market (ch7)
7. The Phillips Curve, IS-LM-PC model (ch8,9)
---extra topic---
AS-AD framework (traditional approach, contradicted with IS-LM-PC model)
---open economy---
8. Open Economy (ch17, 18)
9. Output, Exchange Rate, Interest Rate (ch19)
10. Exchange Rate Regimes (ch20)
---long run analysis---
11. Economic Growth, Solow-Growth model (ch10, 11, 12)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Zhi Gang, I know you tried your best ;)
If you compare his performance in the first class and the last class, you will find out that he has improved a lot :)
In terms of English, not bad but talk too slow. 1.5x will be better.
In terms of Teaching, I feel ok but all his notes and derivation is basically following the textbook.

Do remember to read the corresponding chapters before lecture, you will get a better understanding on the material. The textbook is very easy to follow, which gives you a very solid background on each topic.

It will be better to attend lectures as it provides something that the textbook does not mentioned.  Since there is many good questions asked in class, some of them appears in the exams.

TA Dominic is great. He provides a lot of summaries for the topics taught in class which is great for those who didn't read textbook. It is a must to have his lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade
Homework 30%
Midterm Review Session 5%
Midterm 30%
Final 35%

Homework Does not grade on effort, not like 3113, but they are easy to handle with.

Midterm Review Session: both Prof. and Dominic will hold a review session, attend either one to get free 5%

Midterm, Final: MC and Long Questions
Midterm is easy and Final is a bit hard.

Me:
midterm: 95.5/100 (mean: 77.9)
final: 81.5/100 (mean: 70.1)
other: almost full
Grade: A+
I think it is quite good grade, like in other course it would be an A. Quite surprising.
reviews.comment_workload:
I don't have any other economic background besides the 2103 course. People taking DSE economics should find some topic easier, but I still manage to get a decent result so no worries if you have no prior knowledge.

If you check the syllabus of 3123 and 3143 before this semester, you will find out that 3123 this year teaches maybe 1/3 content that will be taught in 3143 (open economy, exchange rates). Together with the AS-AD model that is covered in 2123.
Therefore, this course is now really an advanced course compared to 2123 but still 3 credits :) and I don't know what 3143 will teach next semester.

It covers too much topics after midterm, most workload comes from the increasing teaching speed and more complex topics.

reviews.author: mhsg
reviews.comment_content: Not very hard and complicated. You can get satisfactory scores as long as making yourself understand most of the content on her PPT. (It is "most" because she will give a lot of real cases and let you watch many videos to help you understand, which may not be strongly related to your exam.)
reviews.comment_teaching: It's Ok but you have to pay much attention on her class since she likes to leave a lot of blanks on her PPT which is really important to the exams for you to fill in.
reviews.comment_grading:
Acceptable
As long as you finish your homework patiently and do some reviews before the exam, you can get a B+ (My mit and final were both a little little little higher than the mean and I got a B+)
reviews.comment_workload:
Appropriate
But do not procrastinate doing your homework. Start doing it after she has released it as soon as possible. We only have 2 homework during the whole semester but the duration of each homework is not very long and the workload could be quite heavy if you want to finish it in 1-2 days.

reviews.author: HiByeByeHi
reviews.comment_content: Midterm 前都比較輕鬆，一開始會recap 少少DSE Econ 嘢，例如gdp 嘅expenditure, value-added, income approach 之類，之前再教Keynesian Cross, Money Market, IS-LM,同埋啲 bond price, share price 點計（fina 2303嗰啲）。Midterm 之後難少少，因為係要base on 之前嘅嘢再develop , 例如 IS-LM-PC, open market 嘅 Keynesian Cross, 同埋 IS-LM-IP。要留意由於mt 比較遲，所以mt 之後都幾chur
reviews.comment_teaching: 其實個prof啲slides都ok, 會有好多real life examples 去到話俾你知個theory 係咪真係work (或者唔work)，不過上堂佢成日播片，播完都唔太知成條片重點，建議睇slides 就ok，同埋啲real life examples 未見過考試出，只有assignment 會搭1，2條。TA 唔太清楚，因為我走曬tutorial 咁濟，不過留意番啲 practice exam answer discussion 係冇recordings 。

IPRS+ in class exercises: 10%
Midterm : 40%
Final : 40%

My grade:

reviews.comment_workload:
算細，得2份problem sets 要做，不過如果想要好grade 建議一定要做：1.practice exam 2.slides 嗰啲唔同scenario 嘅examples 3.tutorial 嘅 exercises 4.上堂iprs

考試mc 基本上睇iprs 保你有7-8成，其他long que 會同上面1，2，3啲 practices 好似。

Introductory course of macro

reviews.author: zkel
reviews.comment_content:
The course is about some basic stuff of macroeconomics. Some content is similar to DSE econ so it will help if you take econ in secondary school. For Professor Lee, He tries to link everything we learn with some empirical evidence and use only simple mathematics for the course. So data is also very important for the course. It is quite interesting in my opinion.
The content of the course include:

Short Run, IS-LM model
1. GDP, Unemployment and inflation rate
2. The Goods and service market
3. The Financial Market (Ms-Md)
4. Goods and Financial Market (IS-LM)
5. Extended IS-LM model

Medium Run, IS-LM-PC model
6. The labor market
7. Phillips Curve
8. IS-LM-PC model

Long Run, Solow Growth Model
9. The Facts of Growth
10. The Solow Growth Model
11. Productivity
reviews.comment_teaching:
I personally love his teaching style. He explains everything in detail to make sure that you understand and answer your question immediately but not after class. He also uses many figures and data to demonstrate different conditions and theories. Paying attention to lectures is already enough for you to get a decent grade.

Also, I would like to mention the TA of the course, Dominic. He provides very detailed tutor notes. His notes have the same importance as lecture notes in my opinion. The notes also cover some parts which are a bit unclear in the lecture notes and some numerical examples of lecture content. Although I seldom attend the tutorial because it is difficult to listen to his voice, his notes are really very good for the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The total grade compose of several parts

Homework x 4 (20%): I loss 1 mark in 2 assignments, 2 in 1 assignment, and full in 1 assignment.

Midterm(35%): mean 78.8% sd 11.5% UQ 88.7%
the midterm is quite easy I think. Just need to pay attention to empirical evidence.

Pre-exam Check-up Section (5%): I believe everyone got full.

Final(40%): mean 69% sd 14% UQ 80%
The final is much trickier than the midterm. I am not confident about my answers. Empirical evidence is also very important.

The grade is very good in my opinion. I have head people getting A+. A range can be achieved if you fully understand the content.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light compare to the other courses I took this semester. You only need to finish 4 assignments, which each can be done in 1-2 hours. For midterm and final, I spent 2-3 days studying each by doing his practice questions and questions in the textbook. It is already enough for a decent grade

reviews.author: Audrey
reviews.title: Good introduction to Macroeconomics
reviews.comment_content:
PPT content almost all taken from the textbook. Professor would do a little modification, add a few slides about updated data and events. So when you review for exams, the book only serves as exercise book :D but the exercises are quite good.
This theory I mainly tells you some models used in macroeconomics: IS-LM model and AS-AD model. Jenny would explain very carefully and you must learn her way of explanation, because this will be tested a lot in the exams.
In this course, we assume that there is no international trade, no export/import. Only consumption, investment and government spending. Bank activities are also simplified. Quite easy to understand. But we shall understand macroeconomics much better when we take international trade into consideration in theory II.
reviews.comment_teaching: Jenny explains concepts rather clearly (her English is good as well). She would draw diagrams and write detailed explanation. Occasionally she also invites students to do the process the same way she does, good practice for homework and exams. Remember to copy her writings, as the scanned version comes out late.
reviews.comment_grading:
Problem sets(Usually 4 homeworks) 21.5%
Midterm 30%
Final(cumulative) 45%
Class participation 2%
Tuto participation 1.5%
TA is usually Astor. I think she prepares the tutorials well: lecture content abstract, textbook exercises, homework explanation. She gives quite good grades for homework. If you are patient enough to wait for paper checking, she is willing to listen to your explanation and add your marks back. Don't be frightened by others' comments that Astor is not reasonable - I really think she is good!
Homeworks, midterm and final are all the same form.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Practice analyzing using IS-LM and AS-AD often.

reviews.author: South
reviews.title: Easy Introductory Macroeconomic Course
reviews.comment_content:
Too easy for MAEC and ECOF students, it may be easier than ECON 2123 this semester, maybe because it's in the transition period of curriculum change.

Short Run, IS-LM model
1. GDP, Unemployment and inflation rate
2. The Goods and service market
3. The Financial Market (Ms-Md)
4. Goods and Financial Market (IS-LM)
5. Extended IS-LM model

Medium Run, IS-LM-PC model
6. The labor market
7. Phillips Curve
8. IS-LM-PC model

Open Economy
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lee is fantastic!

He explains everything clearly, making it easier to memorize the content. Also, he is always willing to answer any questions you may have. Even if the question is trivial and shows that you skipped the class, he would say, "good question."
reviews.comment_grading:
Generally, I don't think it's a good grade course.

Although getting mean in both midterm and final will earn you a B+ (assuming that you got full mark in the assignments, which is easy as you can collaborate with your friends). Given that the students are all from MAEC or ECOF, in other words, they are competitive; it's not that easy to get a mean score.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's hard to tell the exact workload because different people pursue other goals.

There are four assignments throughout the course; each takes less than 3 hours to finish.

Some of the assignments require you to use excel to handle the data.

If you want to get into A range, following the lectures and doing the assignments are sufficient. But if you are pursuing a more in0-0depth understanding of macroeconomics, I recommend you to read the textbook, which will take approximately 4 hours each week.

reviews.comment_teaching: 佢d英文真係有令人沉睡嘅魔力，一堂都捱唔到，完全冇聽過書。
reviews.comment_workload: 得2份hw，有聽書、睇下ppt就會識做。

reviews.author: ustspacer
reviews.comment_content: Basic stuffs about macroeconomics. You will need to focus on how to derive formulas, rather than just memorizing them. Contents are basically about goods market, money market, and labor market in short term, mid term, and long term.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is based on power points and some proofs. Some of power points are not from the text book so you are recommended to attend classes.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading curve isn't really bad. Mean for the midterm and 1sd above mean for the final gave me B+. Highly recommended to learn how to draw graphs from scratch.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 2 assignments for the whole semester. Neither essay nor presentation.
